name: Backend Code Quality
description: Evaluation rubric for backend code (Python, Go)

criteria.name: Correctness
criteria.description: Logic correctness, error handling, edge cases

levels.10: Perfect logic, comprehensive error handling, all edge cases covered
levels.8-9: Correct logic, good error handling, most edge cases covered
levels.6-7: Mostly correct, basic error handling, some edge cases missing
levels.4-5: Logic issues, inadequate error handling, many edge cases missing
levels.1-3: Fundamental logic errors, no error handling, fails on edge cases

examples.excellent: Validates all inputs, handles SQL injection, manages connection errors, covers edge cases like empty strings and null values
examples.poor: No input validation, missing try/catch blocks, fails on null inputs

levels.10: Perfect adherence to style guides, consistent naming, well-structured

examples.excellent: PEP-8 compliant, clear function names (get_user_by_id), proper module structure
examples.poor: Inconsistent indentation, vague names (do_stuff), no module docstrings

levels.10: Optimal algorithms (O(n) or better), efficient DB queries, proper caching
levels.8-9: Good algorithms, reasonable queries, some optimization
levels.4-5: Inefficient algorithms (O(n²)), N+1 queries, no caching
levels.1-3: Severe performance issues, will not scale

examples.excellent: Uses Redis for token caching, bulk DB inserts, O(log n) search with binary search
examples.poor: N+1 queries in loop, no caching, O(n²) nested loops for simple tasks

levels.10: Comprehensive docstrings, clear comments, detailed README
levels.8-9: Good docstrings, adequate comments, basic README

examples.excellent: All functions have docstrings with Args/Returns/Raises, README with setup instructions and API examples
examples.poor: No docstrings, no README, cryptic variable names without comments
